content.description: Start on a low undercling, then move up to a solid hold. The rest of the way is quite simple, since there is a variety of holds. The top out is easy because of a nice crack on top of the boulder. I did not use the arete, so the grade is without the arete. If you use the arete, the grade is lower. It does not matter much in this climb.
content.location: Walk directly away from the main wall towards two big boulders. Swiss Cheese will be located on the farthest one.

content.description: Start with left hand on the arete and right hand on a small side pull. I stick my foot in the bottom crack to help stabilize. Bump the right hand to another side pull higher up. Then prepare for a dyno move to good hold with the right hand again. Then bring the left hand up and top out. The wall to  the right is off limits. Do not use.
content.location: On the second big boulder away from Jaws. Go down below. To the left of Dimer.

content.description: Start on two separate holds, one is an undercling and the other is a pinch. Do a big move to a good jug and reach up to a side pull. Move again to either another side pull or to another jug. From there you can reach the top. I did not use the the arete or the wall to the left. If you use these, then the grade is lowered.
content.location: On the second boulder from the main wall. By Swiss Cheese.

content.description: Big Block 2 has a few boulders on it all located in the back. Topping out on the boulders can be a little tricky due to moss and dirt, so make sure to clean everything off. Getting down is fairly simple. Just watch your step and take it slow.
